business.headline: Venezuela cuts crude output as US oil blockade chokes storageCaracas is in political crisis under an interim government after President Nicolas Maduro and his wife were captured by US forces on Saturday. The OPEC country's oil exports, its main source of revenue, are now at a standstill following a US blockade on tankers under sanctions and the seizure of two oil cargoes last month.

US control of Venezuelan oil could unlock $1 billion in dues for India, lift outputA US-led takeover or restructuring of Venezuela's oil sector could help India recover nearly $1 billion in long-pending dues and revive crude production from fields operated by ONGC Videsh, analysts and industry sources said.

Inside the gig economy: The real cost of your 10-minute deliveriesTen-minute deliveries have become part of everyday life in urban India. What makes that speed possible is rarely part of the conversation. Read on to understand the people, platforms and policies behind it.

Why salaried Indians need a personal finance reset in 2026Rising living costs, changing job patterns and sweeping labour law reforms are urging salaried Indians to rethink how secure their finances really are.

Ban gig work and you don't solve inequality: Eternal CEO Deepinder GoyalEternal founder Deepinder Goyal argued that the gig economy debate is less about wages and more about discomfort with inequality, warning that bans and over-regulation could erase livelihoods instead of fixing systemic gaps.
Sensex closes 573 points higher, Nifty hits fresh high; NTPC up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex added 573.41 points to close at 85,762.01, while the Nifty50 jumped 182 points to end at 26,328.55​​​​​​​.

Cigarettes to cost more from February 1. Here's how new rates will be decidedThe new levies on tobacco and pan masala will be imposed over and above the applicable GST rates. These measures will replace the GST compensation cess, which is currently charged at varying rates on sin products.

Missed the revised ITR filing deadline? Know what happens to tax refundIn most cases, refunds are issued within a few weeks to a few months. Delays may occur due to mismatches in TDS details, bank account validation issues, or cases selected for scrutiny.

ITC shares tumble 4%, down 13% in 2 days: Buy the dip or stay away?The sharp sell-off comes after the finance ministry revised the taxation structure for cigarettes, effective February 1, 2026. Here is all you need to know.

MCX shares crash 80% in early deals, but the fall is not what it seemsMCX shares fell by more than 80% on trading screens on Friday, hitting an intraday low of Rs 2,192 on the BSE. This was compared with Thursday's closing price of Rs 10,988.60.

Devyani International and Sapphire Foods India shares in focus. Here's whyDevyani International shares were trading at Rs 152.80, up Rs 5.37 or 3.64% during the morning session as of 9:39 am. In contrast, Sapphire Foods India shares were trading lower at Rs 253.95, down Rs 8.75 or 3.33%.

Sensex, Nifty open higher driven by auto, metal stocks as FMCG continues to fallThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 172.34 points to 85,360.94, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 44.10 points to 26,190.65 as of 9:26 am.

Gold, silver price today: How have precious metals started 2026?Gold and silver prices moved higher on Friday, recovering part of the losses seen late last week, even as investors looked back at the historic gains these metals delivered through 2025.

Is 10-minute delivery really unsafe? Zomato CEO answers after gig workers strikeWhile delivery services on platforms such as Zomato and Blinkit were largely unaffected on New Year's Eve, questions around whether 10-minute delivery models put pressure on riders gained traction on social media.

If system was unfair...: Deepinder Goyal as Zomato unaffected by gig workers' strikeZomato and its quick-commerce arm Blinkit recorded their highest-ever single-day orders on New Year's Eve, delivering over 75 lakh orders despite a nationwide gig workers' strike. Founder and CEO Deepinder Goyal said such scale shows a system seen as unfair cannot consistently attract or retain workers.

Special Report: India's Economy Faces Trump Tariffs and Trade Impasse Entering 2026In this Special Report, an unidentified speaker analyses the state of the Indian economy as the nation steps into 2026. While highlighting a 'stupendous 2025' marked by major reforms like GST simplification and the Jan Vishwas Bill, the report warns that India enters the new year 'playing on a strong economic pitch, but also on a sticky wicket'. Key challenges identified include the ongoing trade impasse with the US, punitive 'Trump tariffs' of 50%, and a depreciating rupee which breached the 91 mark against the dollar. The programme notes that while GDP growth remains robust at 8%, high food inflation and sluggish job creation persist. With five state elections due in 2026, the report also flags concerns over rising state debts due to populist spending, even as all eyes turn to the upcoming Union Budget in February to restore confidence and boost private investment.

Commercial LPG cylinder price hiked by Rs 111 on New Year, highest since June 2025On New Year's Day, the price of a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was increased by Rs 111 — the steepest hike in six months, — with effect from today. The price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder, however, remains unchanged.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as ITC, Godfrey Phillipss crash on tobacco cess moveThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 32 points to close at 85,188.60, while the NSE Nifty50 was up by 16.95 points to end at 26,146.55.

Silver vs gold vs stock vs real estate: What can deliver most gains in 2026Should it be gold, which has just seen its strongest year since 1979? Or silver, which has surged over 150%, marking one of its best-ever annual performances?

Inside draft labour code rules. What the fine print says on wages, working hoursThe draft Rules relate to the Code on Wages, the Code on Social Security, the Industrial Relations Code and the Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions.

entertainment.headline: Nayak 2: Anil Kapoor to act in and produce sequel, says co-producer Deepak Mukut Nayak: The Real Hero is officially getting a sequel around 25 years after its release. Lead actor Anil Kapoor returns to produce and act in Nayak 2.

Actor Sudha Chandran loses control of emotions at bhajan night, video goes viral Sudha Chandran's video from a bhajan night has gone viral, showing the veteran actor overwhelmed with emotions during the devotional event.

Border 2 actor Medha Rana says Ghar Kab Aaoge song is a tribute to those who wait Border 2 debutant Medha Rana shared a heartfelt note on the emotional depth of the song Ghar Kab Aaoge, calling it a tribute not just to soldiers but also to the families who wait for them.
BTS announce 5th studio album and world tour. Details BTS have officially announced their fifth studio album and a world tour, marking their first full-group comeback in three years and nine months.

Anurag Kashyap reviews Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar: It's his politics Anurag Kashyap has shared his review of Dhurandhar, praising Aditya Dhar's filmmaking and Ranveer Singh's performance while disagreeing with a few dialogues.

Bigg Boss Marathi fame Jay Dudhane arrested over real estate fraud allegation Reality TV star Jay Dudhane was arrested at Mumbai airport in an alleged Rs 4.61 crore real estate fraud case involving mortgaged commercial shops in Thane.

Anupam Kher welcomes Ravi Kishan to Khosla Ka Ghosla 2, calls him a brilliant actor Anupam Kher announced the start of Khosla Ka Ghosla 2 and welcomed Ravi Kishan to the cast, calling him a "brilliant actor".

Ashnoor Kaur says her Bigg Boss 19 moments were cut off, calls out unfair editing Ashnoor Kaur shared that many of her important moments and fights inside the Bigg Boss 19 house were cut during editing, which affected how audiences perceived her contribution. She said the narrative against her was shaped largely by what was not shown on screen.

Parasakthi trailer: Sivakarthikeyan leads a charged political drama Parasakthi is an upcoming Tamil political drama film starring Sivakarthikeyan, Sreeleela, Ravi Mohan and Atharvaa in the lead. The film is set to release in theatres on January 10 during the Pongal/Sankranthi festive season.

Aamir Khan reacts to Sunil Grover's mimicry of him: Felt like I was watching myself Sunil Grover's spot-on Aamir Khan act on The Great Indian Kapil Show left audiences laughing and quickly went viral. Aamir Khan praised the performance, calling it authentic and saying he laughed the loudest.

Dhurandhar: Krystle D'Souza talks about dancing with Ranveer Singh at music launch Krystle D'Souza shared that her live performance of Shararat at the Dhurandhar music launch was completely unplanned, as Ranveer Singh spontaneously pulled her on stage.

Dhurandhar's Shararat gets 100 million views: I am here to rule, says Ayesha Khan Ayesha Khan celebrated a major milestone as her Dhurandhar song Shararat crossed 100 million views on YouTube, winning massive audience love. The actor shared an emotional note thanking fans and the team behind the hit track.

Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu trailer: Chiranjeevi-Venkatesh promise festive fun The trailer for Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu starring Chiranjeevi and Venkatesh was released in Tirupati, setting the stage for its Sankranthi debut on 12 January. The film, directed by Anil Ravipudi, promises an entertaining mix of comedy and action for family audiences.

Rasha Thadani celebrates one year of Uyi Amma song, shares BTS, gratitude note Rasha Thadani celebrated one year of her viral Uyi Amma song by thanking fans for the overwhelming love the dance number continues to receive.

Director Bharathiraja hospitalised after breathlessness, doctor's say he's stable MGM Healthcare confirmed legendary filmmaker Bharathiraja remains under observation and is responding well to treatment after being admitted due to breathlessness.

Bigg Boss 19 winner Gaurav Khanna jokes he still hasn't gotten the car he won Gaurav Khanna shared a fun moment with Bigg Boss friend Pranit More, joking about the car he won on the show, in his latest YouTube vlog.

Allu Arjun holds wife Sneha close as mob surrounds them at Hyderabad cafe Actor Allu Arjun and his wife Sneha Reddy were surrounded by fans at a cafe in Hyderabad following the soft launch of Allu Cinemas, leading to a brief moment of chaos as security and the actor tried to control the situation.

Sara Arjun shares emotional note for audience, calls them her strongest Dhurandhars Sara Arjun expressed heartfelt gratitude to audiences for the overwhelming response to her debut film Dhurandhar, calling their support "forever grateful".

Beach, love, laughter: Alia Bhatt's 2026 postcard with Ranbir and Raha melts hearts Alia Bhatt rang in 2026 with a warm family moment, sharing a dreamy beachside picture with Ranbir Kapoor and daughter Raha. The post caught fans' attention online.

general news.headline: Maduro captured in bold US op. Is arrest of sitting Venezuelan president legal?Nicolas Maduro is in US custody after a surprise American operation that Washington says was about law enforcement, not regime change. Legal experts, lawmakers and allies are now questioning whether the capture crossed red lines in international law.

ICC open to moving Bangladesh's T20 World Cup games out of India: ReportThe ICC is open to moving Bangladesh's T20 World Cup matches out of India. The move comes after Bangladesh registered an official request to move their games out of India in the aftermath of Mustafizur Rahman controversy.

Rubio walks back on Trump's claim to 'run' Venezuela, says US won't governTrump repeatedly told reporters that the United States would "run" Venezuela for the time being following overnight US strikes that led to the capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

Paisa-wasool mentality turning Indian holidays into headachesTravel is meant to be an escape from the mundane of daily life — a chance to relax, unwind, and return rejuvenated. For many Indians, however, holidays often turn into checklist-driven exercises, leaving people to return home not refreshed, but anxious and exhausted.
How the US pulled off the daring abduction of Nicolas MaduroAn extraordinary US special forces mission exorcises the ghosts of past failures.

Biting cold and dense fog to persist over North India on January 5The IMD has issued a cold wave warning for parts of North India on January 5 as dense fog continues to lower visibility. Devendra Tripathi also predicts light snowfall in the northern mountains and shifting clouds over the plains.

These Indians studied at Harvard 100 years ago, long before studying abroad became a thingThe Kosambi family were among the earliest Indians to study and teach at Harvard University. Their journey highlights challenges faced and contributions made to global education and Indian historiography.

Live: Concerns increase in Cuba after US Vice President JD Vance's statementUS–Venezuela Tensions Live Updates: The turmoil in Venezuela continues a day after the country's ousted President Nicolás Maduro was captured at the hands of US troops in Operation Absolute Resolve. As per the direction of the Venezuelan Supreme Court, Delcy Rodriguez, the country's former Vice President, took charge as the Interim President. Rodriguez, a leader with a strong leftist background, earlier expressed her solidarity with Maduro and acknowledged him as the only administrative head of the country. Meanwhile, the US has issued a fresh threat to Rodriguez, citing that she would face grave consequences if she does not follow the right path. Washington on Monday also took a U-turn from its earlier position, saying that it would not govern Venezuela as Trump claimed earlier. Follow indiatoday.com to get all the live updates.

Bondi hero Ahmed al-Ahmed gets standing ovation from sold-out SCGBondi hero Ahmed al-Ahmed was honoured by the Sydney Cricket Ground on Day 1 of the final Ashes Test match. Al-Ahmed had risked his life to save civilians when two armed men opened fire at Bondi Beach on December 14, 2025.

Bigg Boss Marathi fame Jay Dudhane arrested over real estate fraud allegationReality TV star Jay Dudhane was arrested at Mumbai airport in an alleged Rs 4.61 crore real estate fraud case involving mortgaged commercial shops in Thane.

Bangladesh cricket official explains call to not play T20 World Cup in IndiaT20 World Cup 2026: Bangladesh have requested the ICC to move their matches from India to Sri Lanka. BCB director Faruque Ahmed explains to India Today how the country's cricket board arrived at that decision.

Can't use power banks on flights: Airlines begin enforcing safety rulePower banks may travel with you, but they can't power your devices mid-air. With safety risks linked to lithium batteries, airlines are now making clear onboard announcements to enforce a long-standing aviation rule.

Watch: Strange pillars of light seen falling from space in RussiaStunning light pillars illuminated the night sky north of St. Petersburg, Russia, in a breathtaking natural display in January 2026. This optical phenomenon turns freezing air into a canvas of vertical glowing beams.

3 arrested for beating, burning Hindu businessman to death in BangladeshThe accused were detained from Kishoreganj following an investigation that led to the formation of special teams. Authorities said the suspects have prior criminal records, and further probes are underway.

Pregnant woman killed over dowry in Rajasthan, in-laws attempt secret cremationPolice said bloodstains were found inside the house, along with weapons including an axe, spade and sticks. The victim's husband, Pankaj Thakur, has been arrested, while other members of the in-laws' family are absconding and are being searched for.

Not independent sovereign state: Chinese envoy in India reasserts claim over TaiwanAccording to Xu Feihong, Taiwan's status as part of China is supported by historical and legal evidence, and Beijing considers reunification inevitable.

A Thank You note to Stranger Things: For the journey, friendships, and the feelsNetflix's hit series Stranger Things might have come to a close, leaving audiences in splits – emotionally and critically – but its impact endures, immortalising its characters in the hearts of millions of fans.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Any Venezuela takers? Jack Ryan clip goes viral as US raid mirrors 2019 TV plotA dramatic US raid on Venezuela and the capture of President Nicolas Maduro has unexpectedly revived a scene from Jack Ryan Season 2. The six-year-old clip is going viral for how closely it echoes today's geopolitical reality.

Final fight against Congress, DMK: Amit Shah vows poll wins in Tamil Nadu, BengalUnion Home Minister Amit Shah addresses a rally in Pudukkottai, asserting BJP-NDA's prospects in upcoming state elections and outlining the party's position against the ruling DMK.

Border 2 actor Medha Rana says Ghar Kab Aaoge song is a tribute to those who waitBorder 2 debutant Medha Rana shared a heartfelt note on the emotional depth of the song Ghar Kab Aaoge, calling it a tribute not just to soldiers but also to the families who wait for them.

AAP sarpanch shot dead while attending wedding function at Amritsar resortEyewitnesses said the wedding celebrations were proceeding normally when the attackers arrived from outside and fired at least two shots at the AAP-affiliated sarpanch before fleeing the spot.

Bangladesh poll body cancels Hindu leader's nomination for upcoming electionsThe Bangladesh Election Commission has cancelled the nomination of Govind Chandra Pramanik, a prominent Hindu leader and lawyer, citing non-compliance with rules requiring independent candidates to submit signatures of 1 per cent of voters from their constituency.

Allu Arjun holds wife Sneha close as mob surrounds them at Hyderabad cafeActor Allu Arjun and his wife Sneha Reddy were surrounded by fans at a cafe in Hyderabad following the soft launch of Allu Cinemas, leading to a brief moment of chaos as security and the actor tried to control the situation.

sports.headline: Bangladesh cricket official explains call to not play T20 World Cup in India T20 World Cup 2026: Bangladesh have requested the ICC to move their matches from India to Sri Lanka. BCB director Faruque Ahmed explains to India Today how the country's cricket board arrived at that decision.

Jay Shah's mission Olympics: Want 100 medals from India in 2036 Former BCCI president Jay Shah wants a 100 medals from India in the 2036 Olympics. Shah, who now heads the ICC made his statements during the Run for Girl Child Half Marathon in Surat.

No rings on Day 1: National Boxing Championship delayed after logistical nightmare A chaotic, ringless start delayed the National Boxing Championships by over four hours, leaving boxers waiting in uncertainty as logistical lapses disrupted what was meant to be a landmark opening day.

Bondi hero Ahmed al-Ahmed gets standing ovation from sold-out SCG Bondi hero Ahmed al-Ahmed was honoured by the Sydney Cricket Ground on Day 1 of the final Ashes Test match. Al-Ahmed had risked his life to save civilians when two armed men opened fire at Bondi Beach on December 14, 2025.

IPL Controversy: BCB Cites Security Threats And Demands Relocation Of World Cup Games To Sri Lanka In this special broadcast, the focus is on the escalating diplomatic and sporting tension between India and Bangladesh. The controversy stems from the Indian Premier League (IPL) franchise Kolkata Knight Riders reportedly releasing Bangladeshi pacer Mustafizur Rahman following political pressure. In a retaliatory move, the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has officially requested the International Cricket Council (ICC) to shift their T20 World Cup matches from India to Sri Lanka, citing security concerns. The programme features a discussion on the implications of this decision, comparing it to Pakistan's stance, and explores whether politics is overshadowing the spirit of the game. Experts debate if this sets a dangerous precedent for global sports and if the IPL brand value could suffer due to such geopolitical exclusions.

BJP Calls Shah Rukh Khan 'Traitor' For Signing Bangladeshi Pacer; BCB Cites Safety Fears For Boycott In a major geopolitical escalation affecting cricket, the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has announced it will not travel to India for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026. The decision follows the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) instructing the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) to release Bangladeshi pacer Mustafizur Rahman from their squad. The BCCI cited 'recent developments' and safety concerns for the directive. The move has triggered a political storm, with the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) criticizing KKR co-owner Shah Rukh Khan. Former Bangladesh captain Mohammad Ashraful, speaking exclusively to India Today, expressed sadness over the developments.

WPL 2026: Meg Lanning appointed as new UP Warriorz captain The Australian legend, Meg Lanning is set to take over as the captain of the UP Warriorz franchise ahead of the 2026 edition of the Women's Premier League

Atul Wassan Backs BCCI: 'Eye For An Eye' Stance Right on Bangladesh T20 World Cup Threat Former India cricketer **Atul Wassan** supports the BCCI's decision to exclude Mustafizur Rahman from IPL 2026, calling it a justified response to public sentiment. Speaking on the Bangladesh Cricket Board's (BCB) threat to boycott T20 World Cup matches in India, Wassan dismisses it as "shadow boxing" and argues that Indian cricket will not be isolated. NTV Sports Editor Barshan Kabir also joins to discuss the political pressure behind the BCB's stance.

Atul Wassan Defends Shah Rukh Khan Amid Row Over KKR Dropping Bangladeshi Player In a discussion on the diplomatic fallout affecting cricket, former Indian cricketer Atul Wassan weighs in on the controversy surrounding the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) and the Indian Premier League (IPL). Wassan argues that targeting KKR co-owner Shah Rukh Khan for the franchise's initial bid for a Bangladeshi player is 'totally wrong' and 'unfair,' describing the actor as a 'low-hanging fruit' for public sentiment. He contends that while the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) may have taken the right step given the current 'political turmoil' and attacks on minorities in Bangladesh, removing a single player is merely 'shadow boxing' and will not solve the broader issues. The show, hosted by Nikhil Naz, also touches on the Bangladesh Cricket Board's request to move matches to Sri Lanka and the revocation of No Objection Certificates (NOCs) for players.

Tyson Fury set to come out of boxing retirement in 2026 Former world heavyweight champion Tyson Fury declared his return from retirement, igniting renewed speculation about a long-awaited bout with Anthony Joshua. Fury's career has been marked by dramatic highs, retirements, and a string of major victories.

Debate: BCB Refuses To Play T20 World Cup In India Citing Security And Political TensionsOn this Special Report, the focus is on the major decision by the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) to not play the T20 World Cup on Indian soil. The move follows the exclusion of pacer Mustafizur Rahman from the Indian Premier League (IPL) due to security concerns. A former India cricketer supports the BCCI's stance, citing public sentiment, while a guest from Bangladesh highlights the political pressure driving the BCB's decision. The programme explores the 'tit-for-tat' dynamics and the potential isolation of cricket teams amidst rising political tensions.

Bangladesh Asks ICC to Move T20 World Cup Matches From India Citing Security ThreatsA major controversy is brewing in the world of cricket, as reported by India Today. The Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has officially requested the International Cricket Council (ICC) to move all of its T20 World Cup matches out of India, citing 'security threats to some of their players'. This development follows the recent controversy where Bangladeshi player Mustafizur Rahman was released by his IPL franchise, Kolkata Knight Riders, reportedly under pressure on the BCCI. The BCB's request mirrors a similar move by Pakistan, which has already arranged for its matches to be played in the tournament's joint-host nation, Sri Lanka. The ICC has not yet made a decision on the BCB's request to have its matches rescheduled in Sri Lanka.

ICC open to moving Bangladesh's T20 World Cup games out of India: ReportThe ICC is open to moving Bangladesh's T20 World Cup matches out of India. The move comes after Bangladesh registered an official request to move their games out of India in the aftermath of Mustafizur Rahman controversy.

Usman Tariq defends controversial action, calls critics illiteratePakistan spinner Usman Tariq has defended his controversial action. While his critics continue to allege that he chucks the ball, the spinner has said that illiteracy can kill knowledge.

Hardik Pandya, India's X-factor in India's T20 World Cup 2026 squad: De VilliersAB de Villiers has backed Hardik Pandya as India's key match-winner for the T20 World Cup, praising his ability to change games with both bat and ball and calling him a pivotal figure.

PM Narendra Modi says India are preparing with full strength to host 2036 OlympicsPrime Minister Narendra Modi outlines India's strengthened preparations to host the 2036 Olympics, with a renewed focus on athlete opportunities, policy reforms, and infrastructure expansion, as demonstrated at the 72nd Senior National Volleyball Championship in Varanasi.

Zak Crawley frustrates the life out of me: Michael Vaughan tears into England batterMichael Vaughan criticised Zak Crawley's lapses in concentration after another soft dismissal in the Sydney Test but insisted the England opener still has far more to offer and should continue to be backed.

Sarfaraz Khan's fitness concerns leaves Mumbai's knockout push at risk: ReportMumbai's Vijay Hazare Trophy knockout hopes are under threat after a heavy loss to Maharashtra, compounded by Sarfaraz Khan's quadriceps injury, NRR concerns, and a tense finish to the group stage.

RCB, RR set to play IPL matches in Pune? Teams inspect stadiumRoyal Challengers Bengaluru and Rajasthan Royals have visited the MCA Stadium in Pune as contingency preparations ahead of the IPL season. Both franchises are facing logistical hurdles in hosting matches at their respective home venues, prompting them to explore alternative options.

T20 World Cup 2026: Bangladesh Seeks Venue Shift To Sri Lanka After Mustafizur Rahman's IPL ExitIn this Special Report, India Today's Principal Correspondent Anirban Sinha Roy details the escalating cricketing diplomatic row as Bangladesh refuses to travel to India for the 2026 T20 World Cup. The decision follows the Bangladesh Interim Government's directive to the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) to seek a venue shift to Sri Lanka. The move comes after the BCCI reportedly asked Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR), co-owned by Shah Rukh Khan, to drop Bangladeshi pacer Mustafizur Rahman, citing attacks on Hindus in the neighbouring country. Bangladesh's Sports Adviser Asif Nazrul termed the BCCI's stance a 'communal policy' in a social media post. The report highlights the logistical challenges for the ICC, with matches originally scheduled at Kolkata's Eden Gardens now in limbo.

Shubman Gill's T20 World Cup snub leaves Ponting stunned: I couldn't believe thatShubman Gill's omission from India's squad for the T20 World Cup 2026 has left Ricky Ponting stunned. Yet the legendary Australian captain admitted that such is the depth that Indian cricket possesses currently.

Ashes: Former England captain urges Test mindset shift after rain-hit Sydney TestMichael Vaughan questioned Test cricket's approach after rain and bad light cut short Day 1 at Sydney. With thousands in attendance, the former England captain urged officials to rethink decisions that denied fans valuable playing time.

Bangladesh writes to ICC, seeks to move T20 World Cup matches out of IndiaBangladesh have refused to travel to India for the 2026 T20 World Cup, citing player safety concerns after Mustafizur Rahman's IPL release and formally asking the ICC to shift their matches to Sri Lanka.

Real Madrid monitoring Rodri situation at Man City after Xabi Alonso hint: ReportsReal Madrid are quietly tracking Rodri's contract situation at Manchester City ahead of the summer. A potential move would be laden with irony, given his Ballon d'Or win over Vinicius Junior and Madrid's subsequent protest.

Sir Alastair Cook as next England coach? British legend opens up on future prospectsFormer batter Sir Alastair Cook has expressed interest in coaching England in the future but confirmed he has had zero contact from the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB).

Damien Martyn wakes up from life-threatening coma in meningitis battleLegendary cricketer Damien Martyn has woken up from a life-threatening coma in his battle with meningitis. His remarkable recovery is being described as miraculous by family and close friend Adam Gilchrist.

Liverpool will not win the Premier League: Reds star makes harsh confessionAlexis Mac Allister has admitted Liverpool's Premier League title defence is slipping away. The midfielder's blunt assessment reflects the frustration inside Anfield after a turbulent season marked by heavy spending, change and inconsistent performances.

Don't know why Nitish Reddy was picked over Ruturaj Gaikwad: Former India batterSubramaniam Badrinath has questioned India's ODI selection logic ahead of the New Zealand series. The former batter believes Ruturaj Gaikwad was overlooked unfairly, while Nitish Kumar Reddy's inclusion raises concerns.

Brendon McCullum the best coach I've ever had in my career: Harry BrookHarry Brook praised Brendon McCullum's coaching influence as key to his prolific Test form, starring again in the Ashes with an unbeaten knock at the SCG despite England trailing the series.

Amid ugly Mustafizur Rahman saga, Bangladesh name T20 World Cup 2026 squadLitton Das will captain a 15-member Bangladesh squad for the T20 World Cup in India and Sri Lanka. The announcement comes a day after KKR confirmed the release of Mustafizur Rahman from their IPL squad.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
